ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Honestly, not really sure. We learned about Mesopotamia and the rise of states.
A deep understanding of the Archaeological and Anthropological roots of STATE and Society. What is the causation, and what can be measured to determine were circumstances?

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Although the topics discussed in the course were quite interesting, the lectures were disorganized and difficult to follow.

I thought the class was pretty dry and struggled to engage, both during class time as well as with the readings which were far more often than not incredibly dense pieces of literature that were hard to digest and made the course content even less approachable. I think the course, and the field as a whole, could do with more conciseness and clarity to make it easier to understand what is going on and engage with the material.
I think this course was very unfocused, and I wasn't sure what I was supposed to be getting out of each class.
I absolutely loved this class  one of the best I have ever taken

I think there should be student-led classes. Allowing the students to combine their interests with what we learn could be an opportunity to allow students to absorb more and effectively apply the information in a unique way within and outside of the classroom.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Only if you need an EVST social core and there aren't any other available options. I don't really know why this course is allowed to count towards the major, and would probably recommend EVST 473 instead, which seems to be much more applicable to environmentally-related subjects. This course seemed far more suited for anthropology or classics majors.
Absolutely! Harvey Weiss is such an incredible professor who knows so much. Some students dont understand his teaching style but if you go with the flow youll learn so much
Yes. It is a unique dive into topics that Prof Weiss understands beyond textbooks understanding.
